borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p>The proposed side extension for reasons of design fails to respect and reflect the character and appearance of the host
property as it introduces a new roof design at this location. Likewise, for reasons of size, scale and sitting the proposed rear
extension will appear disproportionately large in comparison to the host property, therefore, it will appear at odds with the
character and appearance of the dwelling, terrace row and surrounding local area. The proposal therefore constitutes
uncharacteristic and unsympathetic development, as such, it is considered unacceptable and contrary to:</p><p>-
National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)
Policies D1, D4 and D8 of the London Plan (March 2021)
Policy CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010)
Policy BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)
Policies SP2, SP4, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (October 2020)
Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Extensions and Alterations (March 2012)&nbsp;<br></p>

<p>The proposed rear extension for reasons of size, scale and sitting would result in the material loss of light and constitute overbearing and unneighbourly development detrimental to the standard of living of current and future
residents of 130 Oxlow Lane. The proposal is therefore considered unacceptable and contrary to:</p><p>-
National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)
Policies D1, D4 and D8 of the London Plan (March 2021)
Policy CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010)
Policy BP8 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)
Policies SP2, SP4, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan Regulation 19 consultation version (October 2020)
Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Extensions and Alterations (March 2012)<br></p>
description: Demolition of existing extension, construction of a single storey rear and side wraparound extension, a first floor rear extension and a new first floor window on the left elevation,  a hip-to-gable roof extension to accommodate a rear dormer extension including three roof lights to the front to facilitate conversion of roof pace into habitable accommodation, floor plan redesign and all associated works.
